body:
Further information:
image size is 240*120, while the ui node size should be 30px high and fits text length, `BorderRect` size is 48 px squared

An addendum:
seems ButtonBundle works fine, only ImageBundle and AtlasImageBundle has this problem(source from bevy discord)
![image](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/assets/38809254/382a6a05-7231-45d2-bed6-488d123ee785)
(lower one is ButtonBundle )

body: Could you provide some code to reproduce ? I made the slicing feature so I might be able to help and fix it

> Could you provide some code to reproduce ? I made the slicing feature so I might be able to help and fix it

I think the 9-slicing example can tell by replacing `ButtonBundle` to `ImageBundle` or `AtlasImageBundle`.

 ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/38809254/305865073-382a6a05-7231-45d2-bed6-488d123ee785.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..SSkd_AEbCPHh4oyY3jpgC64MhInJQ2RxYHrMcXVKD6M)

Because the upper one in this image also has this problem, but the actual button is larger than the image size, so I will also rename the issue.

rename.from: 9-slice sprite is behaving weirdly on UI when sprite size is smaller than texture size
rename.to: 9-slice sprite is behaving weirdly on ImageBundle and AtlasImageBundle

body: Texture atlas are not supported by slicing yet, but the Image bundle should work, I'll try

rename.from: 9-slice sprite is behaving weirdly on ImageBundle and AtlasImageBundle
rename.to: 9-slice sprite is behaving weirdly on ImageBundle

body: @Litttlefish Yup it doesn't work with `ImageBundle`, my bad this is due to a mistake in my implementation, I'll open a PR right away

issue.body:
# Objective

Fixes #11944

## Solution

#11600 made an incorrect assumption on what `UiImageSize` does, removing its usage in slicing fixes the problem

body: @Litttlefish Can you try with the fix ?

> @Litttlefish Can you try with the fix ?

Tried, seems it works normally now.

issue.body: # Objective Follow up to #11600 and #10588 https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/issues/11944 made clear that some people want to use slicing with texture atlases ## Changelog * Added support for `TextureAtlas` slicing and tiling. `SpriteSheetBundle` and `AtlasImageBundle` can now use `ImageScaleMode` * Added new `ui_texture_atlas_slice` example using a texture sheet
